message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond as a primary or secondary school teacher from Slovak Republic to a survey about AI in education. I need to provide responses for each of the 10 statements about AI.

Let me think about each statement from the perspective of a teacher:

[TT4G35A]: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - This is a positive use case. AI can definitely help with this. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35B]: "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - This is another positive use case where AI can help personalize learning. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35C]: "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - This is about individual support, which is a positive use. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35D]: "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)." - This is a positive use for supporting diverse learners. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35E]: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - This is clearly true. AI can help with grading, attendance, scheduling, etc. I would say "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35F]: "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - This is a risk/negative aspect of AI. This is concerning. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree" that this is a risk.

[TT4G35G]: "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - This is a risk. AI can make mistakes. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35H]: "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - This is another risk. I would say "Agree" that this could happen.


The remaining concerns involve data protection and pedagogical appropriateness. AI systems could compromise student privacy and security, and they might suggest teaching methods that don't align with sound educational practice. Both warrant agreement as legitimate risks to consider when implementing AI tools in classrooms.
